CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1959, pg. 6, 7, reads: "'A Home Show Named Success' must be the appropriate label tagged to the ninth annual Courier Home Service Fair, held at the massive Syria Mosque, last Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights. This will be the most talked about 'Fair' ever.  From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences...Exhibitors Attaches 'Success' Label to The Courier Fair as they vied for homemakers' attention from the most dazzling and colorful array to displays ever exhibited at a local home show.  Among them was... (12) Cake-baking contest judges were Mrs. Frankie Pace, Mrs. Martha Tyson and Mrs. Alberta Wright... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Alberta Wright, Martha Tyson, and Frankie Pace, at 1959 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair, Syria Mosque
CatSubject_tab: Signs--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Advertising--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.

cutline: 'A Home Show Named Success' must be the appropriate label tagged to the ninth annual Courier Home Service Fair, held at the massive Syria Mosque, last Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights. This will be the most talked about 'Fair' ever.  From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences...Exhibitors Attaches 'Success' Label to The Courier Fair as they vied for homemakers' attention from the most dazzling and colorful array to displays ever exhibited at a local home show.  Among them was... (12) Cake-baking contest judges were Mrs. Frankie Pace, Mrs. Martha Tyson and Mrs. Alberta Wright... - Harris Photos.
